Reviews.Title: “absolutely devastated”
Reviews.Author: loren p
Reviews.Content: i carnt believe the scam of this hotel..the pics are nothing like the hotel it reminded me of the hotel in the film hostell..as soon as i got there i cryed my eyes out it was dirty disgusting and didnt feel safe at all..it should be shut down the owners should be ashamed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!so glad i left and managed to get another hotel

Reviews.Title: “Walked in, walked out!”
Reviews.Author: carpone
Reviews.Content: Worst place I have ever visited. The reception area was a bombsite....luggage all over, dust everywhere. The net curtains were grey, tinged with black. The place smelt; musty old and damp. The lift was a disgrace. The carpets in the hallway were heavily worn through to the flooring underneath. The door to our room didn't fit in the frame leaving enough of a gap above to be able to look up and down the corridor. The room itself was tiny. No tea/coffee facility, headboard for the bed was at an angle and the room totally univiting. Dust all around the skirting boards and radiator. This place should not be classed as a hotel. It was more like a refuge. Had to wipe my feet on leaving the place. There was no-way I could subject my family to staying in this place even for one night. Cancelled and moved to another hotel that did exactly what it said. En-suite etc etc and for a cheaper rate. One other thing to note is they only have 1 (one) iron shared between the 30+ rooms. Even then they want a deposit of £10 for use of it. Oh, almost forgot...... there is building work going on Half the hotel is scaffolding. Maybe that should also be added to the booking site!. Our room was on the same corridor as the works with a sheet up at the end.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: raja935
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is very close to the Tube station (Manor House) and that is the main advantage of staying there. Not the safest area in London, specially at night. The room was dark, small, a very small window. In summer time you may not have a good sleep, no circulation of air. Bathroom was nice but shower didn't work at all. Breakfast is mostly included in the rate, for those who never had English Brekfast and want to try first time -- don't believe Majestic Hotel Breakfast is actually the authentic one, quality of food not very good either. Kitchen staff were friendly. No internet available, but there is a Internet Cafe close to the Station. The room service didn't clean the room, had to request Reception to make sure it is done next time. One final thing, there is no extra lock inside the room. On the whole, would think twice before staying again there.

Reviews.Title: “Revolting place should be closed down!”
Reviews.Author: ToniLymeRegis
Reviews.Content: I went to this hotel in August to meet my lovely niece who was over for a trip from Australia with her friend. The hotel looks ok from the outside but as soon as you enter the reception area the nasty truth begins to dawn. The place is absolutely filthy, how it passed any official inspections is beyond me. I decided to have a look at their room and quickly wished I hadn't. The tiny lift was dirty and when it stopped and opened, we were greeted by builders with drills and dust everywhere, I even had to wade through rubble in a very expensive pair of shoes ( I wasn't happy!) The corridor was extremely narrow, dark and dirty, even each individual room door was filthy. I can't even describe how disgusting the room was. I have stayed in every type of hotel over the last 20 years and I have never experienced a place like this in my life, in fact I didn't even know a place like this existed in London. Even the staff wandering around the hotel seemed to have a lot of scabs on their faces. This hotel has the audacity to be more expensive than Travelodge or Premier Inn. Please somebody have this place closed down, we are better than this in England!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs Galore!”
Reviews.Author: Joy B
Reviews.Content: This place is the most disgusting place I've ever stayed in. The room had brown stains all over the walls, the curtains had holes all over them, the bathroom was dark and not clean, the hallway leading to the room was dingy. My friend commented it looked like a hotel from a horror movie. In the morning we found bed bugs all over the sheets, blood on the sheets from where they had feasted on us during the night. When we told the staff, you could tell that they knew there were bed bugs which was the most distressing part of the stay. I couldn't live with myself if I worked somewhere like that and charged people money to get bitten by bugs and sleep in a dirty hellhole. The place should be shut down by the health inspectors. Was very surprised to find a place like this in Kensington.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: colinmatts
Reviews.Content: I sincerely hope that the Health and Safety people read this review because this excuse for a hotel should be of even more concern to them than to prospective visitors to London. I was lumbered with it as part of a package deal and I honestly considered finding a cheap B&B and forgoing the £60 a night I'd paid in advance. My single room resembled a monk's cell in a monastary far more than it did anything one would expect from the hospitality trade. It was bleak, cramped and wholly unwelcoming. The floor sloped at a forty-five degree angle. The bathroom door didn't close properly. Most amazing of all though, there was no tea and coffee making facilities in the room. It remains the only catering establishment I have ever stayed at which didn't offer that most basic of refreshment. The dangerous element was the bathroom, or to be more specific, the shower. The tiny cubicle did not have a door or even a curtain across it. This meant that water spilt out as you were showering and made the journey from the shower cubicle to the bathroom floor a treacherous one. An elderly person or anyone unsteady on their feet would quite honestly be taking their life in their hands using this shower. I might also add that the toilet seat was improperly fitted and a sign above the hand basin warned against drinking the water. If all that doesn't put you off then beware of the breakfast rip off. Despite the words "English Breakfast" being underlined on my breakfast card, I had to make do with the continental bread rolls, coffee and juice laid out in the dining room. I waited for three quarters of an hour for the English breakfast to arrive but was left waiting. You'll probably say I slould of comlpained. However, there was only one person working in the dining room and she didn't speak much English. Travel agents should really remove this delapidated wreck from thier lists of approved accomodation. Tourists should avoid it like the plague and Health and Safety should be alerted to it urgently.

Reviews.Title: “Not great...”
Reviews.Author: MumCheese
Reviews.Content: The first thing I will say is this, I found these reveiws the night before our trip to London and was in tears, after saving hard to take my son to London for the weekend. The first time we have been away together, he's 15yrs old. So write the truth, but remember that people read these too. Well, obviously after reading the other reveiws I was quite worried about this place, and I won't lie, it's not great! The first oom we were given, had a stong chemical smell to it, the beds were clean, but it was very tatty and grubby. So I asked the very kind receptionist if we could change rooms because of the smell. She couldn't of been more helpful, letting us look at another room before we decided to take it. The second room was fine, clean and tidy. Nothing wrong with it at all. We slept well and the breakfast was fine, served in an light and airy room and plenty of food. IF they decorated and cleaned, I would use this hotel again, just because of it's location and the wonderful staff. I think maybe that some rooms are worse than others. If you are just using it as a base, like we did, it's not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “i can't believe we even booked it! hotel inspectors needed!!”
Reviews.Author: j_burns077
Reviews.Content: if we didn't laugh at the bad then we would have gone insane...surprisingly i slept great the bed was comfy.. thats all that was good. as soon as we got into reception the floors were creaky like they would fall through..this was the same on every floor. and the ceilings above looked like was going to fall on you as you sleep! there was no kettle, the shower looked like it would dribble so we didnt use it, my friends rooms bath had a hole that had been pollyfilled and looked hillarious! the lift felt like could stop at any time, we joked that the scratches in the walls of it was them trying to escape! it would be worth to go across the road to the marriot!! it would only of been £50/room/night extra and so worth it. if i have any advice do not book, i feel sorry for the coach load who arrived as we left!

Reviews.Title: “Better stay in the middle of desert than here”
Reviews.Author: egyptianCairo_Egypt
Reviews.Content: very bad hotel , not clean , very smelly , bad treatment from staff , never stay in it.

Reviews.Title: “A scruffy, noisy, student-magnet, there are better places to stay at this price”
Reviews.Author: sirduncs
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights. First the positives: - 5 mins walk to Gloucester Rd tube - A Sainsburys, and several places to eat, all within easy walking distance - Satellite TV in the lobby area Now the negatives: - It's a mecca for student groups from overseas. This is a problem because they tend to be noisy, irritating and poor fellow guests. The noise in the hotel from banging doors, people staying up late and being noisy, and hanging around, was highly intrusive. - The hotel needs refurbishing. It's looking faded and tired, with scuffed carpets and a lack of TLC. - No internet access. - The hotel is on a busy main road where there are deliveries, a thoroughfare of taxis, cars and buses - and you can also hear tube noise. - The radiator was always on, with no means of turning it off - meaning the window needed to be open, which meant a noisy night's sleep - Previous reviews have suggested bedbugs. No evidence for me, although two issues I must draw your attention to: I noticed several ants in the breakfast room on the tables where the buffet-style food and croissants were. This represents a BIG hygiene problem. Secondly, I have begun to itch a bit since staying in this hotel. Like I say, I didn't see evidence of any infestation or pest problem (apart from the ants at breakfast) BUT I do suspect that multi-legged creatures are at work behind the scenes at the Majestic Hotel. Would I stay here again? Definitely not. There are better options for the price. Please avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Hell hole - do not stay.”
Reviews.Author: andrew0905
Reviews.Content: Very tired rundown hotel. Threadbare carpets, TV not working and no hot water. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Very shabby but served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: nostalgia77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is obviously in an excellent location and if you are on a strict budget and don't mind the shabbiness you might stay two nights as I did but certainly no longer. My room was clean but appallingly shabby; the bed looked as though a cat had been scratching the sides of the mattress for years, it was so tattered. The walls were not really dirty but scuff marks were everywhere. A coat of paint would have fixed this. The bathroom was very clean and everything functioned but as I was on the fifth floor I never managed to get hot water. I suffered one very chilly shower and didn't risk another. The breakfast was adequate, plenty of tea, coffe and bread rolls, but I had a problem in conveying to the young man on duty that I would like a fried egg. I think that I had to order it the night before but it might have been my error. I did get one though. Interestingly the breakfast room could have been beautiful if it hadn't been so bare and cold. I really like tea/coffee facitlities in my room and had they been provided I could put up with the rest for a short stay as the price is very reasonable by comparison. However, given the hotel's location I feel that the shabbiness of my single room and the delapidated state of the furniture in reception are quite a letdown for a London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “VERY DATED”
Reviews.Author: anjie42
Reviews.Content: On arrival its looks quite nice from the outside, though it was dark, inside the floors all creak and it just looks old. Staff were very helpful. The rooms were adequate, draughty but warm, TV, no T & Coffee making facilities,bed had sheets & blankets. Bathroom was clean but all just need modernising! Gloucester Tube just 10 min walk, Natural History & Victoria & Albert Museums 10 min walk, a central starting point if you are sight seeing. To be fair £45 per room per night was a good deal, though not sure i would go back!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel, no hot water with -2C winter.”
Reviews.Author: ly_thach
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights, the worst 2 nights of our 3-weeks holiday trip. The only thing that's working was the heater, and thank god for that, because it's -2C outside. But the window seals were broken so cold air still came in the room. My son wnet non-shower for 2 days. I braved a cold shower once. That gave me another bad reason not to come back to this hotel : I had to wad through my own brown water as the drainage in the shower could not cope edaquately !

Reviews.Title: “Never stay in this hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lelka
Reviews.Content: horrible hotel. the only type of advantage - is its location close to the center. After the arrival of this hotel is being treated of scabies! all dirty and old. Do not stop it if you dear to your health

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel. Shame about the bedbugs.”
Reviews.Author: ra123498765
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at this hotel and was impressed initially by the location and the low price. But after a few nights I started developing itchy red bumps. I could only guess they were bedbug bites and after researching them online I found out that they can stow away in your luggage. So after a quick glance over my suitcase low and behold I found a group of them hiding in the lid, which was horrible. Therefore unless you want to be in itchy pain for a week after, DO NOT STAY HERE. Its really not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Horiffic is an understatement”
Reviews.Author: A_C_M89
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally the worst place I have ever been. My boyfriend and I booked in to stay there and checked out half an hour later - we were happier to pay for a new hotel altogether than stay another minute in this place. The beds were hideously uncomfortable and covered in bugs. There was litter all around the room and to top it off we found an old condom (yes, you read that correctly) hanging off a pipe in one of the wardrobes. Would I recommend this hotel to a friend? Ten thousand times no. I wouldn't even wish a night in this place on my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: TheVampireKat
Reviews.Content: I went down to London this weekend to celebrate my birthday and this hotel ruined the whole experience for me. We were booked to stay from friday to monday. We arrived at the hotel and though ooh this actually looks nice. We went in, got our key and went up to our roopm. As soon as we stepped out of the lift we thought oh no. The paintwork was patchy, you could see where the holes in the walls had been plastered over and the carpets were all worn, faded and threadbare. It was worse when we got into the room. The sheets had holes in and on the first night (ironically my birthday) we got woken up by bed bugs crawling on us. The next day we stripped the sheets off and saw them all in the mattress. We went down and asked (very nciely) for a different room. They could not accommodate us in a double room so put both of us in a single room instead. This room was even worse. There were bedbugs of varying sizes everywhere! We didnt get any sleep at all on saturday night. Went on a bus tour on Sunday morning and decided to cut the holiday short because we couldnt face one more night in that place. All our things have had to be repeatedly washed (we both bought new things especially for the weekend) and I am acually going to throw the cheaper items i took with me away and just buy new ones. It is awful and as soon as I find out how to contact this hotel I am going to complain directly to them. It is disgusting and dirty and bug infested and I wouldn't even want rats to stay there to be honest.

Reviews.Title: “Functional at best”
Reviews.Author: cambert
Reviews.Content: The Majestic is a threadbare hotel with no comforts and little to recommend it. Coffee/tea-making facilities were entirely absent, for example, and my room had no bedside table. On the positive side, the staff were pleasant, the room was clean enough, and the tube station was just a short walk away. Whilst the room was cheap, it still wasn't good value for money. I only stayed one night so the lack of comforts were no big deal, but I certainly wouldn't stay there for longer than that.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap in two different meanings”
Reviews.Author: Annlo011
Reviews.Content: I do not mind staying in a simple and worn hotel but what I do appreciate is a well cleaned bathroom which was not the case at our stay. My bed comfort though was excellent but I heard from colleagues that it varied from room to room. The worst experience was that of a colleague and his wife who got bitten by bed bugs so there was blood on the sheet in the morning and one visible bug was still in the bed. They moved to another hotel right away. The personnel was not overwhelmingly serviceminded and breakfast was rather poor, but the location of the hotel was perfect with an underground station nearby. Yet another colleague - who stayed a little longer than the rest - thought that the impression of the hotel got better by the lenght of his stay.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid......unless desperate”
Reviews.Author: billy1910
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this excuse for an hotel because of location. The room had no drinking facility and we could not drink the tap water (there was a label to this effect). The TV had more foreign stations than usual ones,and you could not tune in any local ones. The radiator was on constantly, so we had to open window to 'chill' the room. Bed was ok because we were out until 3.30 am and were too tired to worry about anything. First impression was dirty & dingy, the bar was not open when we went down at 7pm, so we went to our 'party'. When we got back in, we didn't use lift because our room was near the stairs, so we decided to walk up the plastic covered stairs. Before that however, we met one the house pets...........a cockroach (nowhere near the kitchen). The breakfast was horrible (frozen and rarely cooked sausage, tinned mushrooms in brine and half cooked bacon along with syrup like coffee), and they served bread rolls instead of toast. The white table cloths were covered in clear PLASTIC........felt like we were at nursery school. We didn't complain because we just wanted to get out of there............never again.

Reviews.Title: “Bedwants!”
Reviews.Author: kelsjen
Reviews.Content: Hello! I only want to tell that in the majestic hotel are bedwants! Little bugs who get into your clothes and suitcases! I hope you will do something with this kind off information cause it's a big problem if you get these bugs into your own home! It's not worth the money if you have to let a bug exterminator come. You have to look very well to see them...but they are everywhere..trust me! I have them now in Holland!

Reviews.Title: “If you're not a rat, don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: LondonHotelwatcher
Reviews.Content: If youre not a rate, and don't like things that rats like, such as small dirty, dodgy places do not go there. Seriously. It's so bad, price is not even an issue. You can go somewhere else for the same price or if you have to pay 10 more pounds just pay it. It's too bad to stay there. Just trust me. I just have pity for the staff that works there. Don't blame on them. However if you see the owner, give him some little pieces of cheese, rats love it, so he may give you a room where you can actually sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience!”
Reviews.Author: Devins1
Reviews.Content: What a bad experience! Booked in for three nights. Staff very unfriendly on arrival. Rooms are not up to standard with live wires exposed in rooms. Beds dirty and very uncomfortable. On day two the hotel informed us that we had to check out and move to another hotel, as they could not accommodate us anymore! Had to move a group over to another hotel after we had fully paid Majestic. Choas erupted after they started moving people to another hotel and it was such a bad experience! At least the hotel they moved us to was sooooo much better... felt like a palace compared to this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “it'll do”
Reviews.Author: annarose21
Reviews.Content: Was good for location, radiators were always on which meant the rooms were like saunas! one of the windows was broken and so couldnt be opened. because we opened the other during the night the traffic kept us awake. was really worried after reading the reviews but for the amount we paid and considering we only stayed 2 nights it was okay. There are things like mucky skirting boards, tape holding various things together and wires hanging off the walls which dont exactly fill you with confidence. plus the fire alarm had been taken out of our room. Breakfast was horrible. All in all it served its purpose but it wasnt good enough to want to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “And i wood of thought the days of Fawlty Towers were well and truly gone by now !!!”
Reviews.Author: flossie13
Reviews.Content: Ok yes we did book this hotel last minute however yes it was cheap and we wanted somewhere central to stay in london for a quick 'getaway' weekend. Upon arrival at the hotel, we noticed how the floor was rather unlevel in places and we proceeded up to the reception where we met 'Basil & Cybil' as we called them because it seemed to us like a Fawlty Towers type hotel. We were rather shocked to hear a lady complaining at the front desk as we arrived to say that for the second day running her shower still wasn't working and neither was her TV. She said that she also would have rung down to reception to tell them however her telephone wasn't working either. We finished booking in and were given our key to a room on the 4th floor and took the rather small lift up to this level. When we opened the door we discovered that we had a twin room rather than the double we had booked online. My boyfriend said right turn around let go and get this sorted out. We went back down to Reception and requested the double room that we had booked online. We were told there were no double rooms available and could we do the first night in this room. We said no because we specifically requested this hotel because a double room came up. Eventually the 'Basil' behind the desk rang someone on his mobile phone and we were given a new room 106 on the first floor. When we got into this room we thought we had better check out the facilities in case they weren't working. We checked the shower and the TV and the telephone and they were all working. Although the room was small it seemed ok however the heating was on full pelt and in this small room made it very very hot inside already. We tried to open the door and there was a chain on it so we partially had it open and let a small breeze in through the door. We requested the heating be turned off to be told it went off at 10pm however it was still on at midnight. There was no smoke alarm in the room either which i would of thought would have been a basic requirement of any hotel regardless of star rating. When i booked the room i said to my boyfriend that it didn't say if there was any tea of coffee making facilities at the hotel. He said he thought that there probably would of been. There wasn't but this would have been an added bonus to the rooms. We didnt get breakfast included and i dont really think we missed anything to be honest. The roof inside the bathroom looked as though the bathroom above had fallen through at some point and evidence of a water leak too which had been patched up.The bed had a 'mongy' brown blanket on the bed and the pillows were not the most generous with sizes. The back stairs entrance was quite 'grubby' and the place smelt quite a lot of smoking, and the front stairs that we tried to access was only a 'fire exit' and not an immediate link back to the hotel. The hallways upstairs are in need of an overhaul and new carpet too as in some area the pathway dips. Ok if you are still reading this,although we did find the room outdated and basic it was VERY clean and the room was serviced when we left out the card on the door. Clean towels were also left and generally tidied too. This hotel is in a fantastic location for London and tubes and buses etc. There is a sainsbury literally outside the hotel to the left, and is a in a great central location. If i was (which fortunately for my boyfriend i am not) a 'high mainentance girflfriend' there is no way we would of stayed 5 minutes in this place. You also have to pay up front for your rooms - we did wonder if this was because most people stayed one night and then found somewhere else to stay !!!! We felt that this is the kind of hotel which if booked like we booked it would be a once only visit to it and then find somewhere different next time. Good luck if you stay here !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “This is hell on earth, stay away!”
Reviews.Author: Krisbergem
Reviews.Content: I was not expecting anything fancy for the price we paid. But as Majestic calls itself a hotel, I did not expect the following: -Black pubic hairs on the sheets of the bed, plus stains. -A bathroom completely covered in dirt -Dirt coming out of the water tap - forget brushing your teeth there -Filthy, filthy carpets and curtains -A complete lack of service and friendliness from staff So, if you visit London and want to stay in a hotel, avoid this place. It is truly horrible. It does not feel safe at all, as a woman I found it down right uncomfortable to walk in the dodgy corridors by myself. Visitors appeared to be very drunk, and there was no security, as far as I could tell. The fact that this place is called a hotel says a lot about the English living standard. In any other country this place would never pass for a place humans can sleep. And to pay for it as well...No, this place will destroy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “Forget the breakfast and enjoy the budget price”
Reviews.Author: vikingtraveller07
Reviews.Content: After the first morning, we didn't return to the breakfast room and went to a café across the street. But I have had breakfasts of similar standards in other hotels in London, and at least there were neither watery scrambled eggs, soggy toast or burnt bacon because there was none of it! That having been said, and admitting that the room was not too big (but kind of charming in its almost bohemian way), I have to say that the staff was extremely nice and helpful, the location not too bad (bus 74 brings you to an amazing number of central places, and there are a lot of restaurants around Earls Court station), and the place was clean. And the café across the street makes a good coffee. Especially in London, it's an OK place, although not more than that.

Reviews.Title: “We were scared about the reviews”
Reviews.Author: GraceDCanada
Reviews.Content: After reading some reviews we were worried about where we had been booked by our travel agent. However, even though the room was small and the halls were narrow, we were satisfied with our room. Small, neat. clean,bathroom ok and pleasant staff. So for those who were complaining ..not sure which room you were in but ours was fine,

Reviews.Title: “Come and see- a journey into Dante's 7th circle of hell”
Reviews.Author: TubbyBartonYorkshire
Reviews.Content: In my 51 years on this planet i have been fortunate to stay in many hotels - some fantastic,some terrible the majority somewhere in between,but this hotel,boy oh boy,this is the worst one ever,it is a hotel stripped of any humanity,a hotel just stripped to the bare bones a bed a room,but don't accept the "what do you expect for that amount of money" argument i have stayed in cheaper in london and some of them have been a bit ropey and to be honest i don't like much the bland chain hotels so often end up in fawltyesque joints that at least have a bit of character - there ain't no character here !don't bother complaining because none of the east europeans who work here give a flying fig if you r happy or not.A lot of the people staying here were foreigners on holiday to london and it made me feel ashamed to be british to see them all being ripped off and treated so brutishly.Brreakfast (!) was the bare legal minimum that could be provided and still be described as such.To sum up filthy,soulless,noisy,ugly,cold,brutal,uncomfortable,depressing.AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Appalling place - don't touch with a bargepole!”
Reviews.Author: liz77Fareham
Reviews.Content: Suspicions were raised on entering - threadbare carpets, shabby decor and chipped counter. I was asked to pay up front and though i had stated on my booking that i had a teenager with me and asked for information about rates i was told I had to pay the full rate for her. One lift had scraps of old carpet and rubbish in it, the other slash marks, smelt of alcohol and seemed to have bloodstains (seriously!). The carpets are completely worn through in parts, the corridors are dirty, tatty and smelly. When we got to the room none of the furniture, curtains, bedspread or anything matched and looked to have been purchased 20 years ago as a job lot. Oh and the toilet leaked so there was water all over the bathroom floor. This was a stay in London for my birthday and I cried. This place is DREADFUL and should be removed from any booking list.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!”
Reviews.Author: Candycloud
Reviews.Content: Must say that me and my friend were a little intimidated by all the reviews, we had booked before we read any of them. And good thing we didn't read! I can't believe so many have had such bad experiences, because we faced hardly any problems during our stay. Okay true that it could use a minor update (especially the carpets) but we didn't mind that at all. As we were checking in we encountered one of the most helpful and nice receptionists ever (long brown hair, piercing in nose, very smiley) who provided us with lots of info and tips throughout our stay. As we headed up to our room we noticed that one of the two elevators was broken, but it had been fixed already the same night. So no problems there. Our room was situated on the 2nd floor, the window facing Cromwell Road, which is a very busy street even in nighttime. Once closed, the window blocked out surprisingly much of the noise, but I'd still recommend to bring a pair of earplugs. Pop them in your ears and you'll sleep like a baby through the remaining traffic sounds. The room itself was very basic, but provided us with all that we needed; Two single beds (as we had requested) comfortable, neatly made, clean sheets & fairly comfy pillows, enough table- and closet space and a clean bathroom. We both had large suitcases and placing them open on the floor called for a little puzzling, but we managed fine. As mentioned, our bathroom was great, nothing nasty bout it. Sink and tub were both clean, towels and soaps were changed every time, the shower worked just fine (not too cold or too hot) and had good waterpressure. Even our toilet was scrubbed every time! Now, you need to pay attetion when closing your door. Especially if you leave your window open, and try closing the door too hard, it'll just pop right open again. So close with care, and double check, and you'll be just fine. The key needs to be left at the reception, but you get this "room ID-card" that you'll need to show every time you retrieve your key. I can't comment neither the restaurant nor the breakfast, since we ate out every day. And I would have wished for the rooms to be equipped with a fridge and a safe, but again, that's just me. And you'll be fine off without them as well. For the location; it was fabulous! Close to two tube stations, museums, Harrods, Hyde Park, eating, pubs...you name it! And the big Sainsburys (open 24 hrs during weekdays) was a nice plus as well. So me and my friend absolutely recommend the Majestic to all those travelling on a budget and aren't too picky :)

Reviews.Title: “bad bad bad”
Reviews.Author: irl-gin-1
Reviews.Content: Stay away never stayed in a pit as bad as this. You would be cleaner and safer sleeping on a park bench

Reviews.Title: “Burn it to the ground!!!”
Reviews.Author: grotfejset
Reviews.Content: Woredown ugly carpets, creaking floor on the edge of caving in totally Small, no double beds available instead you get 2 separate beds. And you don't get a blanket either. Just a some dirty sheets. One day when we came back to the hotel we found that the door to our room was left open and noone was there. The maid had forgotten to close the door... You can't drink the water in the bathroom. Rude staff... And don't even get me started on the "Genuine Italian Restuarant" located inside the hotel.. It was the worst meal I ever had in my life. The first time I just couldn't eat at a restaurant. The food was so disgusting and bland..and it smelled weird. And at those prices!! With 20 % extra for "service".. And the breakfast was really bad too. Just some croassaints (spelling?) with different types of pre-packed jam. The first morning when I came down I was like: Where is all the food???? I also got some fleebites staying at this hotel. So now I'm sitting here at home terrified that I have brought the flees home!!!!!!!! There are so much more I could say about this lousy excuse for a hotel but I feel so depressed just thinking about what were supposed to be me and my boyfriends romantic one week vacation.....

Reviews.Title: “A grotty hellhole that should be pulled down”
Reviews.Author: kerryguy82
Reviews.Content: Even in Ireland, Kensington is well-known as the most affluent, sophisticated part of London, so you would have thought a 2 star hotel here would be of similar standard to a three star elsewhere. What we booked into would have been comic if it wasn't so dire. A disgusting carpet, combined with flaking, mold-encrusted walls created an atmosphere reminiscent of both the corridor scene in The Shining and the set of That 70's Show. The rooms were basic and served their purpose, with the most polite thing to say being that we spent as little time in them as possible. We couldn't wait to book out, and generally, the place looks about 30 years overdue a makeover.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for this place”
Reviews.Author: Dawn1128
Reviews.Content: I took my daughter here instead of having her go on her senior trip to Mexico. We checked in and were told that the hotel was having an electrical problem , we were put on a bus to a youth hostel in Notting Hill, The room had a PAD LOCK and long 30 year old FILTHY orange SHAG carpet, beds with the springs showing. The bedding was so dirty and the smell was horrible that we never once put our stuff down. Immediately checked out and went to beg for a room at the Radisson. Hotels in London are often sold out and the Radisson across from Harrods in Knightsbridge only had one night of the available, we need three I was so upset the people at the desk there sent us to the Radisson Edwardian in Covent Garden and we told them what happened and they gave us one of their best rooms. It cost me two hotel rooms as the Majestic did not refund my money for three nights. DONT EVER GO THERE!

Reviews.Title: “So-so”
Reviews.Author: Nuora
Reviews.Content: Actually, it wasn't that bad. I'm surprised to see all the negative reviews on here. It wasn't great, but it was ok. The room me and my friend stayed in was very clean. It was tiny, hot as if you were living in the desert and the shower was cold (though with the hot rooms, this wasn't a big problem), but it was never dirty. You're right about that the breakfast sucked and the lobby and the outside did look derelict and in need of a restoration, but i thought it was charming. But maybe that's just me, i've got a thing for derelict houses. Anyway i was very surprised to see the "Don't drink the water" sign on a hotel and it lowered the standard quite a bit for me. Well they could have a happier staff i guess. But the location and the area it was in was awesome and i don't mind a five minutes walk to the underground at all. Still, it was my first and my last visit and the next time i go, i will find a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed by Majestic Hotel - "Majestic" is a euphemism!!”
Reviews.Author: Dunstaffnage
Reviews.Content: I am sorry for not being able to recommend the Majestic Hotel without serious hesitation. I stayed there for 3 nights, together with several colleagues during a conference at the nearby Natural History Museum. Overall, the rooms and corridors are in a fairly derelict, shabby state – the hotel really needs some major, general refurbishment. However, the most annoying and disturbing aspect of my stay was my experience with the hotel management. The receptionist asked me to pay the entire amount due upon check-in with my credit card. After check-in by mid-day, I realized that the shower in my room (# 113) did not yield any warm water (in January!), but its use resulted in flooding the bathroom. I tried again the next morning, and so did my room mate (an old friend, attending the same conference) – despite letting the water run for several minutes, it remained less than lukewarm. I reported it to Reception, who said that they would send in their maintenance staff. When trying again the next morning, the water was still cold. I returned to the receptionist, who said that the maintenance staff member had inspected the shower and not found any fault, but that they would look at it again. On day 3 and when checking out, I reiterated to the receptionist that the problems with the shower had prevailed throughout my stay, and that I would expect some form of discount or partial refund. The receptionist said that she had no means of refunding me anything since the payment had been made, but that I should talk to the hotel manager who was bound to arrive an hour later. Indeed, I waited for the manager. He left me with an impression of arrogance and dishonesty (in contrast, I would characterize the 2 ladies staffing the reception as friendly, but helpless). He refused to give his full name other than “Alex”. He started off by disputing that there had been any problem with my shower in the first place, since he trusted his maintenance staff member – when I asked him to go to the room together with me to convince himself that the shower was not working properly, he refused. He said that he was not willing to issue me any partial refund since “the bill was closed”, but when I insisted, he hinted that I might get a discount during a future stay at his hotel – however, when I requested a written statement confirming this, he refused and said that it would be enough to remind him of me. I then suggested that he should give this discount to my friend who had been my room mate and who was staying still longer – which he also refused. Also, he was very reluctant even to issue me a receipt for my stay. Overall, very dodgy and unfriendly. In conclusion, you should seriously reconsider whether you want to market this hotel – I would probably withdraw it from your website’s selection of hotels since it might damage your agency’s reputation.

Reviews.Title: “Well we got there.....”
Reviews.Author: Mulivijena
Reviews.Content: Finally got there after about an hour of getting lost, only to see a very unhappy couple in front of us... didn't think much of the reception. Anyway when we finally got to the receptionist (who was a right moody cow) she told us there was something wrong with our room and also the other couples room, so she rang for a taxi for us to go to another hotel, she even told us it was better than The Majestic! Its was, when we finally got to the other hotel they knew nothing about us, so after a looooooooong time and alot of ringing the majestic back up and having 'words' 3 hours later we were in our much posher hotel, where we will stay again! So dont bother with the majestic.

Reviews.Title: “Why all the terrible feedback?”
Reviews.Author: trgrrr
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here, a really positive surprise after reading all the bad reviews on here. Sure, it could use a coat of paint and some new carpets in the hallways, but what do you expect when you book one of the cheapest hotels in London? All the staff were very polite and helpful, the rooms and beds were clean and tidy and the location was great. I highly recommend this hotel if you just need a simple place to stay, a comfortable bed, and aren't too picky.

Reviews.Title: “avoid”
Reviews.Author: twempy
Reviews.Content: one of the worst hotels i have stayed in ,it is in need of a complete refurbishment the paintwork is dirty everywhere the room is the most basic you could find,we paid extra for the worst full english breakfast i have had the pleasure to eat when i asked for toast i was just told no,the hotel staff wasn't helpful at all not recommended

Reviews.Title: “Yuckkk”
Reviews.Author: Hearts15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with 3 friends. We all were in one room with 4 single beds bit of a squash. On arrival the staff were quite rude and hardly spoke english. Went downstairs to use to toilet and what a shock we got, the lift is probably not legal and the hallway downstairs was disgusting, dirt everywhere. Toilets were a horrible baby pink colour looked like it hadnt be updated since it opened. Hallways were creaky and smelly. Noisy neighbours. No shower curtain, shower went from hot to cold all of the time. Everytime you lease hotel you need to hand key in, when collecting key when coming back no ID needs to be shown so anyone could walk into your room.Only good thing about this hotel is its location which is 5 mins walk to tube station which takes 5 mins to get into centre london(oxford circus). Sainsburys next door is good for a late night feast after a good night out in london. But i would not recommend this hotel i would pay a litttle bit more and stay somewhere nicer and maybe walking distance to oxford street.

Reviews.Title: “"Snot" so majestic”
Reviews.Author: Shenbob
Reviews.Content: It was foul, no other words for it. the door didnt lock properly. Two of my friends and i were sharing the room so i had to roll my temporary cot in front of the door just so we could feel somewhat safe at night. there was snot on the walls next to my friends bed, the sheets were dirty and there were people playing football in the halls at night. When we called reception nobody answered, we called multiple times and never got an answer. When leaving the hotel you had to leave your key at the reception but when collecting it you were not asked for ID so anyone could have gotten into your room. the bathroom floor tiles were cracked and caused a hazard, a sign said do not drink the water and the shower was always cold. the cleaning staff obviouslycant tell dirt from the general state of the hotel because of the snot they left on the walls and the fact that they decided to move the contents of the bin not to the dumpsters as one would expect but into MY bag. Another member of our group, who was sharing a different room had a melted pile of jelly babies stuffed beside her bed and the toilet in that room was broken and causing alot of noise. When the staff were alerted to this they made us feel like we were pretentious little princesses for wanting a working toilet. The staff on reception were not very helpful and often quite rude. All in all i would suggest anywhere else. Nothing is worth the filth we met in this disgrace.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: kiki0906
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in such an awful place in my whole life. i joined this website just to warn people about this hotel. they obviously dont care what people think of it because they put no money into the place. even as we approached the hotel when walking down the street the building looked in awful condition. i immeadiately thoought what have i let myself in for. the walls need a lot of work, the floors need new carpets, they need proper new locks on the doors, one push and the door opens, they do not answer the phone in reception. i tried to ring them 3 times when there were people playing football in the narrow hallways and no phone was answered. there was snot on the walls next to one of the beds, it was disgusting. the tiles in the bathroom floor were all broken, and so dangerous. there was no fan in the bathroom so it was quite mouldy. we had a triple room and my other 2 friends had a double and their toilet wasnt working and was leaking. the shower was cold. when u leave the room u must leave the key in reception but they dont check any ID when you collect the key in the evening so anyone can walk to the desk. get your key and go into your room. i will never stay there again and i would never recommend it to anybody!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Drink the Water”
Reviews.Author: FlGatorgal
Reviews.Content: My roommate and I both had springs sticking through the mattress of our single beds. Taped to the wall of the bathroom was a sign that said "Don't drink the water," which I saw as I was already brushing my teeth. The carpet is worn, the floors are uneven, the hallways narrow--the place feels like a firetrap. It did appear fairly clean. It is in a great location & about a 5-7 minute walk to the subway. I would definitely upgrade & pay a little more for better accommodations the next time. There is nothing majestic about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: JADELLINE
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Majestic Hotel and loved it. I read a lot of negative reviews about this hotel after I already reserved, and I must admit that I was a bit scared. However, I must say that I had a wonderful experience. The staff was very friendly and the location is great! Granted the hotel is in need of minor updates, but that did not bother me in the slightest bit. The room was clean and large enough to fit all my needs. The restroom was also very clean. I must admit that I have no idea why so many people have written so many negative things about this hotel. I really enjoyed my stay here and I would suggest it to my friends. If you are someone that wants to have a clean room, friendly staff, and a nice place to lay your head after seeing the town, then this hotel is perfect for you. However, if you are someone that wants all the extras, in a hotel, and plan on living in the hotel the entire time you visit London, then perhaps you should book your stay somewhere else. Again...I truly enjoyed my stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing majestic about it”
Reviews.Author: tah4349
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel during a European vacation a while ago. It was disgusting. Awful. I don't even understand how they are still in business. Everything about the hotel was dirty and unclean. The rooms are hot with no source of ventilation. The bathrooms were gross and tiny. I literally walked into the room and started crying, it was that bad. We spent the rest of the day looking for another hotel, but unfortunately during the height of tourist season, we couldn't find anything in our price range. Next time, I'll definitely loosen the purse strings a little more and get something nicer. The location isn't that great - there is a tube station, but it's quite a walk down a very busy street to get there. There is a grocery store next door to the hotel - that was a godsend, because we were able to get our breakfasts and such there. The restaurants in the area are lacking. The staff were unfriendly and unhelpful. They hardly acknowledged us enough to give us our key. Unless you're a 16 year old on your first trip to Europe and are more concerned with getting drunk and being rowdy without your parents, do yourself a favor and find a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ewwwwwwwwww!!!”
Reviews.Author: goodadvisor23
Reviews.Content: I spent 2 nights at the Majestic Hotel, only because the hotel I booked with my 50 classmates burned down. When I first walked into my hotel room, which I shared with three other girls, the first thing I noticed was the heavy smell of cigarette smoke. The walls were bare, but caked with dirt and uneven gobs of paint, which are peeling off the walls. The four beds, I guess you could call them cots, but that's an overstatement, took up all the roomspace and I noticed the room is probably 10 feet by 15 feet. On the beds, there is a cover as thin as the top layer of skin on my finger. A chaperone advised us to take that off, because it looked dirty. Under that was a wool blanket, mine with food crumbs stuck in it. Under that was a sheet, which i also stripped off the bed because, can you believe it? There was a pee stain. So that night I slept on the raw matress, which probably wasn't a good idea, but it was better than the bed i was given. I was scared of what i might find with the pillow so I used my coat. The bathrooms had signs in them that said "Do Not Drink Water!" on them, and my bathroom lights didn't work. One of my classmates said their room didn't even have a door on the shower. Our shower had mold on the handle. The hotel's technician did not know how to fix the lights, so he returned with a friend, who looked rather sketchy with his hands behind his back so we turned him away. We weren't allowed to step on the floor without shoes because it smelled like throw up, as someone probably did. There was no central light, but reading lamps on the wall above the 4 beds. Mine was swinging upside down falling off the wall. Breakfast there was disgusting. I didn't dare try dinner, if they have dinner. I only have one more word to mention: Bugs. If you are thinking about staying at the Majestic, don't do it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: LellaSS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Majestic for 4 days during a school trip. Rooms need refurbishing and updating, but water in the shower was very hot and the heaters were always on, which was good since the weather was really cold. Personally I never had breakfast at the hotel (there are a couple of Starbucks nearby), but most of my students did and say it was awful. Staff very kind and helpful. Location is what makes this hotel special. Only 6 stops from the West End by tube, Harrods and the Museums just around the corner and the big Sainsburys next to the building was open 24/7 , which was the last resort to those students who wanted to grab a bite or a drink late at night. All in all, I wouldn't recommend this hotel to families with children or elderly people for its very basic facilities, but It's OK for students or young couples who can make up for this lack of facilities more easily.

Reviews.Title: “Gross Gross Gross!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: craigdecarlo
Reviews.Content: Wow....this is the worst hotel I've ever stayed at in my life. We are a young couple, with average expecations...we can handle slumming it, but geeze, this place was terrible. Our bed was literally a mattress on the floor, the blue carpets in the hallways were so worn out that they have huge gaps in them. Paint was coming off the walls everywhere. The rooms are TINY, in your washroom, there are signs saying not to drink the tap water (who would anyway? The faucets were covered in grime), there are also posting everywhere saying that we shouldn't leave any valuables in the room because the hotel will not be held responsible for stolen items (so we jsut kept the do not disturb sign on our door all week and refused maid service)...the front desk staff were so dumb -I asked where the West End/Theatre district was and they said they didn't know. The also told us the nearest place you could get internet acces was a 5 minute walk away at Earls Court -when there was an internet cafe a few doors down. Every time you leave the hotel, you have to hand in your room key. One night, we (we're a young couple) came home and there was an older man behind the desk and he wouldn't let us go up to our room because he said that there was only 1 person registered to stay in our room, and he was really rude about it too. I argued and told him that I had made the booking myself for 2 people, he argued back, then I looked noticed that the booking he was looking at was for a completely different room...he apologized, but still...very rude. Don't stay here, seriously. We stayed 5 nights, and pre paid so were were stuck. The location isn't even that great. It's a 5 minute walk to the tube station, and about an hour walk to the centre of town...you can do better.

HotelInfo.Name: Majestic Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 160 Cromwell Road, London SW5 0TL, England
